thread.title: Spiteful way to deal with your legal mistakes?
thread.title_full: Spiteful way to deal with your legal mistakes? | News24

author: news24.com
title: Spiteful way to deal with your legal mistakes?
text:
It doesn't matter if you think he should be in for life or whatever, he has had his day in court ( many many days , unlike JZ ) and the law said he would be eligible for house arrest several weeks back.
After outside pressure they realised that they had made a mess up with announcing the date, and postponed it.
Pistorius still behaved well, didn't throw his toys out of the cot, but then last week the Parole Review Board ran out of time, it was reported , to get to his case - did they look at other cases that day where the Justice Department had not messed up ?
They said there would be a two week delay, and now they say it might be Nov 3rd. It seems like they are playing with him like a cat chasing a laser pointer.
I have no legal knowledge of the laws of murder or culpable homicide, that is what the educated judges are there for, and I will respect their findings, including the States appeal to change the finding to murder, but this spiteful teasing with the house arrest story I feel is bad, and just a bully show of power.
